intro: Ouratea membranacea, commonly known as the membranous ouratea, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often hairy and have a distinctive membranous texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Ouratea membranacea is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often used in traditional medicine.
